formattedAddress: 300 E 89th St, New York, NY 10128, USA
adrFormatAddress: 300 E 89th St, New York, NY 10128, USA

editorialSummary.text: Swanky interior design & dim lighting make this intimate lounge a date-friendly spot.

originalText.text: Bartender could not stop staring at everyone. There were only 2 rooms but he had eyes on everybody the entire time. I felt uncomfortable with him standing there the entire time. Doesn’t he have side work? Maybe wash the dirty menus on your table. Drinks taste like dog water. Could not make a simple lime margarita. Atmosphere is beautiful and amazing, it’s a shame the bartender is babysitting the entire time.

text.text: Bartender could not stop staring at everyone. There were only 2 rooms but he had eyes on everybody the entire time. I felt uncomfortable with him standing there the entire time. Doesn’t he have side work? Maybe wash the dirty menus on your table. Drinks taste like dog water. Could not make a simple lime margarita. Atmosphere is beautiful and amazing, it’s a shame the bartender is babysitting the entire time.

originalText.text:
The location is perfect, as most either don't know about it or skip it entirely. So you get the local frat-mentality types out. No loud morons or what have you. The atmosphere is perfect...very moody vampire diaries feel..with that said.

Some nights you'll get Marilyn Manson themed music (slowly, creepy, Queen of the Damned vibes, which I love) and some nights you'll get something more poppy, which kills the mood entirely.

The bartenders are nice, and always check up on you, with $14 cocktails and you'd imagine they'd match the music with everything else. The whole place is like being a pretentious vampire, which I'm all down for, they just need to focus on a playlist that involves some Arctic Monkeys and or Evanescence....and play it regularly.

originalText.text: This place has so much potential!  It's not realized because of lackluster staff and average drinks. For some reason they turned up the music so loud that it became impossible to have a conversation - did they think it was a dance club?  It's a speakeasy - you need to be able to speak... A number of people asked the bartenders and they said they said they'd handle, but didn't. The good news is that there are plenty of other bars around there!  Drinks are average at best.

text.text: This place has so much potential!  It's not realized because of lackluster staff and average drinks. For some reason they turned up the music so loud that it became impossible to have a conversation - did they think it was a dance club?  It's a speakeasy - you need to be able to speak... A number of people asked the bartenders and they said they said they'd handle, but didn't. The good news is that there are plenty of other bars around there!  Drinks are average at best.

originalText.text: Don’t let the nice pictures mislead you this place was a dump. Tables and furniture were sticky and unkept. Bar was fifthly. I doubt the bartenders had a rag to clean it. Drinks were expensive, like everywhere in NYC, but the alcohol was cheap, cheap well and the sodas used to mix were flat. Doubtless the worst drinks I had in NYC. This place had the high school goth kid vibe. Very disappointed in the experience.

text.text: Don’t let the nice pictures mislead you this place was a dump. Tables and furniture were sticky and unkept. Bar was fifthly. I doubt the bartenders had a rag to clean it. This place had the high school goth kid vibe. Very disappointed in the experience.

originalText.text: Love, love, love! My husband and I have been coming here for years; we enjoy the ambience, the bartenders, and the drinks. A truly lovely "hidden" space on the Upper East Side. We recently (pre-Omicron) had our first small private event here in the front room - Megan couldn't have been more helpful in the planning. She made the whole process stress-free and was flexible to meet our needs. The bartender working the event was great - all of our guests loved him and the venue! Would highly recommend.
